result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Virakone Saenthavisouk in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 7

1:33 PM Defendant Virakone Saenthavisouk in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court explained the process to the defn and his option of proceeding with prelim or waiving the prelim. Court found that the defn has forfeited his right to counsel. Defn elected to waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Case to be forwarded to duty judge for preliminary hearing as defendant is to be representing himself.

records.addlTxt: Appeal of Eligibility Determination for Appoint of Counsel
Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.

Defendant called today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

02:51 PM Defendant appeared.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Virakone Saenthavisouk appeared by video means. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Court gave defendant information on county appointment process.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Zoom
Status conference on April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TLF. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

03:40 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defense moved to dismiss Count 1, made argument. Objection and argument by State. Motion withdrawn by defense. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
